JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Are you prepared to work with enterprise quality assurance in a group that works with some of the biggest companies in the world – then this might be the job for you!

To further strengthening our quality management system (QMS) for software development, we are looking for a Quality Assurance Specialist for the Risk, Security & Compliance department lead by the Group CISO.


This is Stibo
Stibo A/S was founded in 1794 as a printing company to serve the Royal House of Denmark and is still privately held and owned by the Stibo Foundation. Read more about the Stibo Group here https://www.stibo.com.

The Stibo Group serves as a central organization interacting with and supporting the subsidiaries in areas like IT, HR, legal, risk management, information security and general compliance tasks.


Stibo Group has 3 subsidiaries with 25+ locations worldwide:

  • Stibo Systems – a globally leading provider of master data management (MDM) and product information management (PIM) solutions.
  • Stibo DX – a globally leading provider of content management systems (CMS) and digital asset management (DAM) solutions.
  • Stibo Complete – a leading printing company in Scandinavia.
     

This is Group Risk, Security & Compliance
The Group Risk, Security & Compliance department is responsible for establishing and maintaining a high level of information security throughout the Stibo Group based on our 4 pillars:

  • Risk Management (Enterprise Risk Management, risk assessments etc.).
  • IT and information security (CIS20, security architecture, security tools etc.).
  • Compliance (ISO 27001, SOC 2, QMS, internal audits etc.).
  • Privacy (GDPR and other international, regional, and national privacy regulations).
     

We are currently 5 people in the Group Risk, Security & Compliance department, working within and across our security pillars, and our new colleague will be supporting the ‘Compliance’ pillar together with other colleagues of the Group Risk, Security & Compliance department.

This is the job
The purpose of this job is to take responsibility of the maintenance and development of the QMS implemented in R&D, incl. planning and executing the expansions of the organization scope planned.

Furthermore, you will:

  • Maintain the policies, procedures, and controls of the QMS.
  • Conduct compliance audits of the QMS together with Risk, Security & Compliance.
  • Ensure compliance with training requirements for new-joiners and re-training of employees.
  • Point-of-Contact for customer audits.
     

This is you
We expect that you have:

  • Several years of experience working in a similar role.
  • Knowledge of:
    • ISO 9001
    • SAFE
    • Pragmatic Marketing Framework
  • Have strong language skills – preferably fluent – in English and possibly Danish.
     

You do not need to tick all the boxes, but we are looking for an experiences profile. Training courses may be provided.
 

This is what we offer

  • A challenging position, where you as an individual will have a key role in maintaining and developing our QMS.
  • A position in an international company and a global culture.
  • Flexible hours.
     

As we are a global organization, we need to support all our colleagues around the world, so the position may require travelling and occasional meetings accommodating other time zones. This also means that we extend the same kind of flexibility towards your needs and everyday life.

Interested?
We invite candidates for interviews on a continuous basis, so please apply as soon as possible.

 
Should you have questions about the position, you are also welcomed to contact Group CISO Martin Nielsen, Risk, Security & Compliance, on mnie@stibo.com or call via +45 8939 8888.

We look forward to hearing from you.
